alert.note: Alert for Highland; Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 608 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Highland Holiday, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Marshall, Bainbridge, Rocky Fork Point, Cynthiana, Highland Holiday, North Folk Village, Frankfort, South Salem, Sinking Spring, Rocky Fork Lake, Bourneville, Rainsboro, Lattaville, Paint Creek State Park, Summithill, Knockemstiff, Massieville, Scioto Trail State Park and Highland County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
